alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Coal; Hughes; Johnston; Pontotoc; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 4:55AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Johnston, northern Bryan, Coal, southeastern Seminole, eastern Pontotoc, western Atoka and Hughes Counties through 530 AM CST... At 455 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Atwood to near Stonewall to near Connerville to near Madill. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ada, Holdenville, Atoka, Tishomingo, Coalgate, Wewoka, Wetumka, Caddo, Allen, Ravia, Stonewall, Wapanucka, Dustin, Lehigh, Tupelo, Milburn, Francis, Tushka, Calvin and Caney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Atoka; Bryan; Coal; Hughes; Johnston; Pontotoc; Seminole
